Document Title: Interpolation of fuzzy knowledge: a model of human reasoning
Author Affiliations: Department of Information Engineering, School of Computer Science and Engineering, University of New South Wales, Sydney, NSW, Australia
Publication Title: 1997 IEEE International Conference on Systems, Man, and Cybernetics. Computational Cybernetics and Simulation
Abstract: The paper discusses the evolution of fuzzy rule based models applicable to modeling very complex systems, and starting with "classic" symbolic logic based expert controllers/ reasoning systems, going through Zadeh- and Mamdani-style fuzzy models, and continued by the family of rule interpolation based fuzzy systems including hierarchically structured interpolative models.
IEEE Terms: Interpolation;Fuzzy reasoning;Humans;Fuzzy systems;Fuzzy control;Fuzzy logic;Artificial intelligence;Computational complexity;Control systems;Telematics

Document Title: Analysis of the causes of employment satisfaction of fresh graduates from colleges and universities --- Mediating variables based on school employment services
Author Affiliations: School of Finance & Trade, Dongguan City College Dongguan, Guangdong, China; School of Finance & Trade, Dongguan City College Dongguan, Guangdong, China
Publication Title: 2021 17th International Conference on Computational Intelligence and Security (CIS)
Abstract: Employment is the biggest livelihood of the people, and how to make college graduates from “employable” to “well employed” has become an important issue in the employment work of universities and education departments. In this paper, we conducted an empirical analysis on the factors influencing employment satisfaction of fresh college graduates in Guangdong Province in 2021 by structural equation modeling, and concluded that college students' learning ability and psychological quality play a positive role in employment satisfaction, school employment service plays a mediating role in the equation. Countermeasures to improve graduates' employment satisfaction are given in response to the analysis findings to promote colleges and universities to improve their employment services.
Author Keywords: recent college graduates;school employment services;employment satisfaction;mediating effect

Document Title: Design of Photovoltaic Cleaning Robots Assisted by Large Language Models
Authors: S. Chai; W. Ying; R. Wan
Author Affiliations: School of Software Technology, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; School of Software Technology, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Architecture and Design College, Nanchang University, Nanchang, China
Publication Title: 2023 16th International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design (ISCID)
Abstract: With the booming development of the photovoltaic (PV) industry, the cleaning of PV panels has become increasingly crucial. This study, framed under the double diamond model, utilized the large language model (LLM) GPT-4 to assist in designing a PV cleaning robot. Initially, the study involved in-depth market analysis and field investigations to identify consumer needs and design requirements. Subsequently, the Kano model was applied to effectively categorize and assess consumer needs, successfully pinpointing key design directions. GPT-4 proposed numerous innovative design ideas. We created the selected prototypes to test and chose the most promising one ultimately. The results indicate that the overall performance of the scheme met expectations, demonstrating the potential of LLMs in complex product design.
Author Keywords: large language models;photovoltaic cleaning robot;design innovation;double diamond model

Document Title: The Paradigms for the Inquiry in Decision Support System (DSS) and a Design Framework of Cognitive DSS
Author Affiliations: Sch. of Econ. & Manage., Guangdong Univ. of Technol., Guangzhou, China; Autom. Coll., Guangdong Univ. of Technol., Guangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2009 International Conference on Computational Intelligence and Natural Computing
Abstract: Research paradigm plays an important role in the study of decision support system (DSS). Currently most researches in DSS heavily rely on positivist paradigm while other paradigms are ignored. Firstly this paper compares the paradigms for the inquiry in DSS. Then we propose a design framework of cognitive DSS based on dialectic pluralist paradigm. Some major components of the system and the design of key recommendation algorithm are introduced.
Author Keywords: decision support system;cognitive decision support system;interpretivist;dialectic pluarist
IEEE Terms: Decision support systems;Computational intelligence;Conference management;Technology management;Algorithm design and analysis;Automation;Educational institutions;Information systems;Artificial intelligence;Data structures

Document Title: Study on the Enterprise Design Management of External Cooperation
Author Affiliations: Art Institute, Dalian Jiaotong University, Dalian, China; Art Institute, Dalian Jiaotong University, Dalian, China
Publication Title: 2009 Second International Symposium on Computational Intelligence and Design
Abstract: Enterprise design management is not limited to the management of enterprise internal design department; it also contains the management of external design cooperation. This paper elaborates on the external design cooperation management and divides it into five parts, such as cooperation with the design company, cooperation with the free designers, cooperation with college or research institute, cooperation with rivals and cooperation with the upstream and downstream enterprises. Based on the detailed exposition of various design cooperation forms, it is pointed out that modern enterprise should integrate the external design forces and make a good job of design cooperation management. Only in those ways can good products be designed and the enterprise strategy be carried out.

Document Title: The Research of Chinese Text Proofreading System Model
Authors: Y. Luo; J. Yu; X. Cheng
Author Affiliations: College of Computer Science and technology, Shandong Economics University, Jinan, China; College of Computer Science and technology, Shandong Economics University, Jinan, China; School of Computer Science and Telecommunications Engineering, Jiangsu University, Zhenjiang, China
Publication Title: 2010 International Conference on Computational Intelligence and Software Engineering
Abstract: To improve the efficiency of syntactic errors checking and semantic errors checking in Chinese text proofreading, this paper gives a Chinese text proofreading system model based on HNC. This model is a combination of traditional errors checking method and sentence category analysis system based on HNC. The experiment on one hundred articles from daily newspapers and magazines shows that this model has obvious advantages in syntactic errors checking and semantic errors checking when comparing with word2003 errors checking system.

Document Title: A grid-enabled PSE for physical simulation: experiences on GridPSi
Author Affiliations: Graduate School of Science and Engineering, Shizuoka University, Japan; Computer Science Department, Faculty of Information, Shizuoka University, Japan
Publication Title: First International Conference on e-Science and Grid Computing (e-Science'05)
Abstract: As the power of computational grids increases, there is a corresponding need for better usability in PSE community. In this paper, we describe our experiences on design of project GridPSi, a grid-enabled PSE for physical simulation. GridPSi provides a rich suite of functions that facilitate the composition of computational scripts to automate physical simulations by design domain-specific templates for a verity of research fields. The generic functionality provided by it includes problem modeling, mesh file conversion, computational script generation, solution scheme specification and access to grid resources. GridPSi offers a simple interface that is intuitive to users in the human-PSE interactions and ways of thinking. Furthermore, we developed higher-level graphical components named PDE wizards that build upon the core functions to guide users through problem modeling process with minimum effort. By using Unicore as grid middleware, we are lowering the barriers to entry for users wishing to exploit grid technologies
IEEE Terms: Grid computing;Computational modeling;Problem-solving;IP networks;Power engineering and energy;Computer science;Power engineering computing;Usability;Physics computing;Mesh generation

Document Title: Model of Hyper Topology Structure about Associative Thinking
Author Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Xi''an Shiyou University, Xi'an, China; School of Computer Science, Xi''an Shiyou University, Xi'an, China
Publication Title: 2008 Fourth International Conference on Natural Computation
Abstract: This paper researches the essential discipline of reminding thinking based on the practical structure of knowledge presentation, then brings forward the model of Hyper Topology Structure. And it gives not only a method for reminding computing which could integrate to deal with analogy and opposite correlation but also a reminding algorithm of first levels. It is proved that the model is a general one about reminding thinking indeed.
IEEE Terms: Topology;Knowledge representation;Computational modeling;Computer science;Artificial intelligence;Kernel;Mathematical model;Mathematics

Document Title: Co-Designing Machine Learning Apps in K–12 With Primary School Children
Authors: T. Toivonen; I. Jormanainen; J. Kahila; M. Tedre; T. Valtonen; H. Vartiainen
Author Affiliations: School of Computing, University of Eastern Finland, Joensuu, Finland; School of Computing, University of Eastern Finland, Joensuu, Finland; School of Applied Educational Science and Teacher Education, University of Eastern Finland, Joensuu, Finland; School of Computing, University of Eastern Finland, Joensuu, Finland; School of Applied Educational Science and Teacher Education, University of Eastern Finland, Joensuu, Finland; School of Applied Educational Science and Teacher Education, University of Eastern Finland, Joensuu, Finland
Publication Title: 2020 IEEE 20th International Conference on Advanced Learning Technologies (ICALT)
Abstract: Artificial intelligence and machine learning are making their ways rapidly to K-12 education. Google Teachable Machine, powered by convolutional neural networks, provides an easy-to-use yet powerful tool for classification tasks. We conducted a series of co-design workshops with primary school children, where they explored and designed their own machine learning powered applications with Google Teachable Machine. Our results show that Google Teachable Machine is a feasible tool for K-12 education. The trained machine learning models are lightweight and computationally efficient, and the applications are usable even with low-end mobile devices. The students and teachers appreciated the multidisciplinary and inclusive workshop, which supports development of transversal competencies in accordance to the national primary school curriculum.
Author Keywords: Machine Learning;K–12;Co-Design;Artificial Intelligence;Primary School;Neural Network;Computational Thinking

Document Title: A Summer Computing Camp Using ChainReaction and jABC
Authors: A. -L. Lamprecht; T. Margaria; C. McInerney
Author Affiliations: Lero - The Irish Software Research Centre, University of Limerick, Limerick, Ireland; Lero - The Irish Software Research Centre, University of Limerick, Limerick, Ireland; Lero - The Irish Software Research Centre, University of Limerick, Limerick, Ireland
Publication Title: 2016 IEEE 40th Annual Computer Software and Applications Conference (COMPSAC)
Abstract: We have been running summer computing camps at the University of Limerick, Ireland, since 2010. The three-day camps are offered to boys and girls aged 14 and up. During the summer of 2015 we ran two computing camps where we focused on strategy development for the ChainReaction board game with the jABC workflow modelling framework for the first time. In this paper we describe the freely available software packages and the camp programme that we designed around them.
